main event: A UFO was observed by pilots through radar and visually in Knollwood, Ohio on June 15, 1955.
interesting points: The object was reported to be traveling in three big circles, flickering as it did so., It was observed for a duration of 5 minutes., The object stopped, hovered, and then departed rapidly to the west., A subsequent sighting on June 17 involved a bright amber light that was oval-shaped and approximately 40-50 feet in diameter., The object made no sound and vanished unexpectedly in an easterly direction.
sighted object: an unidentified flying object observed as a bright amber light and later as an object traveling in circles
witness description: Pilots observed the object visually and by radar
